alert.note: Alert for Buffalo; Dawson; Furnas; Gosper; Greeley; Harlan; Phelps; Sherman; Valley (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 02 at 1:29PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...Near-Freezing Temperatures Possible Overnight into Tuesday Morning... Low temperatures Tuesday morning are currently forecast to bottom out between 32 to 35 degree range across western portions of south central Nebraska and north central Kansas, with any readings as cold as 32 expected to be brief. However, there is some uncertainty regarding these low temperatures, as continued widespread cloud cover could keep readings a bit warmer than currently forecast, and also prevent frost formation. On the other hand, should more breaks in the cloud cover develop than currently expected, this might allow some places to drop down to 32 degrees or slightly colder, and perhaps allow frost to develop. Given that the most likely forecast scenario currently leans toward low temperatures prevailing slightly above freezing in most areas due to widespread cloud cover, no official Freeze Warning or Frost Advisory is planned at this time. However, those in the area with any concerns regarding sensitive outdoor vegetation may still want to take precautions against frost or freeze, just in case.

area.areaDesc: Buffalo; Dawson; Furnas; Gosper; Greeley; Harlan; Phelps; Sherman; Valley
